language: ENGESV
verse_text: The book of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Abraham was the father of Isaac, and Isaac the father of Jacob, and Jacob the father of Judah and his brothers,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and Judah the father of Perez and Zerah by Tamar, and Perez the father of Hezron, and Hezron the father of Ram,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and Ram the father of Amminadab, and Amminadab the father of Nahshon, and Nahshon the father of Salmon,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and Salmon the father of Boaz by Rahab, and Boaz the father of Obed by Ruth, and Obed the father of Jesse,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and Jesse the father of David the king. And David was the father of Solomon by the wife of Uriah,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and Solomon the father of Rehoboam, and Rehoboam the father of Abijah, and Abijah the father of Asaph,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and Asaph the father of Jehoshaphat, and Jehoshaphat the father of Joram, and Joram the father of Uzziah,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and Uzziah the father of Jotham, and Jotham the father of Ahaz, and Ahaz the father of Hezekiah,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and Hezekiah the father of Manasseh, and Manasseh the father of Amos, and Amos the father of Josiah,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and Josiah the father of Jechoniah and his brothers, at the time of the deportation to Babylon.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And after the deportation to Babylon: Jechoniah was the father of Shealtiel, and Shealtiel the father of Zerubbabel,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and Zerubbabel the father of Abiud, and Abiud the father of Eliakim, and Eliakim the father of Azor,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and Azor the father of Zadok, and Zadok the father of Achim, and Achim the father of Eliud,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and Eliud the father of Eleazar, and Eleazar the father of Matthan, and Matthan the father of Jacob,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and Jacob the father of Joseph the husband of Mary, of whom Jesus was born, who is called Christ.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: So all the generations from Abraham to David were fourteen generations, and from David to the deportation to Babylon fourteen generations, and from the deportation to Babylon to the Christ fourteen generations.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Now the birth of Jesus Christ took place in this way. When his mother Mary had been betrothed to Joseph, before they came together she was found to be with child from the Holy Spirit.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And her husband Joseph, being a just man and unwilling to put her to shame, resolved to divorce her quietly.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But as he considered these things, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream, saying, “Joseph, son of David, do not fear to take Mary as your wife, for that which is conceived in her is from the Holy Spirit.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: She will bear a son, and you shall call his name Jesus, for he will save his people from their sins.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: All this took place to fulfill what the Lord had spoken by the prophet:

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Behold, the virgin shall conceive and bear a son, and they shall call his name Immanuel” (which means, God with us).

language: ENGESV
verse_text: When Joseph woke from sleep, he did as the angel of the Lord commanded him: he took his wife,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: but knew her not until she had given birth to a son. And he called his name Jesus.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Now after Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea in the days of Herod the king, behold, wise men from the east came to Jerusalem,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: saying, “Where is he who has been born king of the Jews? For we saw his star when it rose and have come to worship him.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: When Herod the king heard this, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him;

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and assembling all the chief priests and scribes of the people, he inquired of them where the Christ was to be born.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: They told him, “In Bethlehem of Judea, for so it is written by the prophet:

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “‘And you, O Bethlehem, in the land of Judah, are by no means least among the rulers of Judah; for from you shall come a ruler who will shepherd my people Israel.’”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then Herod summoned the wise men secretly and ascertained from them what time the star had appeared.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And he sent them to Bethlehem, saying, “Go and search diligently for the child, and when you have found him, bring me word, that I too may come and worship him.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: After listening to the king, they went on their way. And behold, the star that they had seen when it rose went before them until it came to rest over the place where the child was.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: When they saw the star, they rejoiced exceedingly with great joy.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And going into the house they saw the child with Mary his mother, and they fell down and worshiped him. Then, opening their treasures, they offered him gifts, gold and frankincense and myrrh.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And being warned in a dream not to return to Herod, they departed to their own country by another way.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Now when they had departed, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream and said, “Rise, take the child and his mother, and flee to Egypt, and remain there until I tell you, for Herod is about to search for the child, to destroy him.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And he rose and took the child and his mother by night and departed to Egypt

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and remained there until the death of Herod. This was to fulfill what the Lord had spoken by the prophet, “Out of Egypt I called my son.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then Herod, when he saw that he had been tricked by the wise men, became furious, and he sent and killed all the male children in Bethlehem and in all that region who were two years old or under, according to the time that he had ascertained from the wise men.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then was fulfilled what was spoken by the prophet Jeremiah:

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “A voice was heard in Ramah, weeping and loud lamentation, Rachel weeping for her children; she refused to be comforted, because they are no more.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But when Herod died, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: saying, “Rise, take the child and his mother and go to the land of Israel, for those who sought the child's life are dead.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And he rose and took the child and his mother and went to the land of Israel.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning over Judea in place of his father Herod, he was afraid to go there, and being warned in a dream he withdrew to the district of Galilee.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And he went and lived in a city called Nazareth, that what was spoken by the prophets might be fulfilled: “He shall be called a Nazarene.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: In those days John the Baptist came preaching in the wilderness of Judea,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For this is he who was spoken of by the prophet Isaiah when he said, “The voice of one crying in the wilderness: ‘Prepare the way of the Lord; make his paths straight.’”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Now John wore a garment of camel's hair and a leather belt around his waist, and his food was locusts and wild honey.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then Jerusalem and all Judea and all the region about the Jordan were going out to him,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and they were baptized by him in the river Jordan, confessing their sins.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming to his baptism, he said to them, “You brood of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Bear fruit in keeping with repentance.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And do not presume to say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father,’ for I tell you, God is able from these stones to raise up children for Abraham.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Even now the axe is laid to the root of the trees. Every tree therefore that does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “I baptize you with water for repentance, but he who is coming after me is mightier than I, whose sandals I am not worthy to carry. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: His winnowing fork is in his hand, and he will clear his threshing floor and gather his wheat into the barn, but the chaff he will burn with unquenchable fire.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then Jesus came from Galilee to the Jordan to John, to be baptized by him.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: John would have prevented him, saying, “I need to be baptized by you, and do you come to me?”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But Jesus answered him, “Let it be so now, for thus it is fitting for us to fulfill all righteousness.” Then he consented.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And when Jesus was baptized, immediately he went up from the water, and behold, the heavens were opened to him, and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove and coming to rest on him;

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and behold, a voice from heaven said, “This is my beloved Son, with whom I am well pleased.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then Jesus was led up by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And after fasting forty days and forty nights, he was hungry.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And the tempter came and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, command these stones to become loaves of bread.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But he answered, “It is written,  “‘Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that comes from the mouth of God.’”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then the devil took him to the holy city and set him on the pinnacle of the temple

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down, for it is written,  “‘He will command his angels concerning you,’  and  “‘On their hands they will bear you up, lest you strike your foot against a stone.’”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Jesus said to him, “Again it is written, ‘You shall not put the Lord your God to the test.’”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Again, the devil took him to a very high mountain and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and their glory.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And he said to him, “All these I will give you, if you will fall down and worship me.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then Jesus said to him, “Be gone, Satan! For it is written,  “‘You shall worship the Lord your God and him only shall you serve.’”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then the devil left him, and behold, angels came and were ministering to him.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Now when he heard that John had been arrested, he withdrew into Galilee.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And leaving Nazareth he went and lived in Capernaum by the sea, in the territory of Zebulun and Naphtali,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: so that what was spoken by the prophet Isaiah might be fulfilled:

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, the way of the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles—

language: ENGESV
verse_text: the people dwelling in darkness have seen a great light, and for those dwelling in the region and shadow of death, on them a light has dawned.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: From that time Jesus began to preach, saying, “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: While walking by the Sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers, Simon (who is called Peter) and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea, for they were fishermen.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And he said to them, “Follow me, and I will make you fishers of men.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Immediately they left their nets and followed him.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And going on from there he saw two other brothers, James the son of Zebedee and John his brother, in the boat with Zebedee their father, mending their nets, and he called them.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Immediately they left the boat and their father and followed him.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And he went throughout all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues and proclaiming the gospel of the kingdom and healing every disease and every affliction among the people.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: So his fame spread throughout all Syria, and they brought him all the sick, those afflicted with various diseases and pains, those oppressed by demons, epileptics, and paralytics, and he healed them.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And great crowds followed him from Galilee and the Decapolis, and from Jerusalem and Judea, and from beyond the Jordan.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Seeing the crowds, he went up on the mountain, and when he sat down, his disciples came to him.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And he opened his mouth and taught them, saying:

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Blessed are those who mourn, for they shall be comforted.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Blessed are the meek, for they shall inherit the earth.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, for they shall be satisfied.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Blessed are the merciful, for they shall receive mercy.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Blessed are the pure in heart, for they shall see God.

language: ENGESV
verse_text:
“Blessed are the peacemakers, for they shall be called sons
     of God.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Blessed are those who are persecuted for righteousness' sake, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Blessed are you when others revile you and persecute you and utter all kinds of evil against you falsely on my account.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Rejoice and be glad, for your reward is great in heaven, for so they persecuted the prophets who were before you.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “You are the salt of the earth, but if salt has lost its taste, how shall its saltiness be restored? It is no longer good for anything except to be thrown out and trampled under people's feet.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “You are the light of the world. A city set on a hill cannot be hidden.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Nor do people light a lamp and put it under a basket, but on a stand, and it gives light to all in the house.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: In the same way, let your light shine before others, so that they may see your good works and give glory to your Father who is in heaven.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Do not think that I have come to abolish the Law or the Prophets; I have not come to abolish them but to fulfill them.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For truly, I say to you, until heaven and earth pass away, not an iota, not a dot, will pass from the Law until all is accomplished.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Therefore whoever relaxes one of the least of these commandments and teaches others to do the same will be called least in the kingdom of heaven, but whoever does them and teaches them will be called great in the kingdom of heaven.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For I tell you, unless your righteousness exceeds that of the scribes and Pharisees, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “You have heard that it was said to those of old, ‘You shall not murder; and whoever murders will be liable to judgment.’

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But I say to you that everyone who is angry with his brother will be liable to judgment; whoever insults his brother will be liable to the council; and whoever says, ‘You fool!’ will be liable to the hell of fire.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: So if you are offering your gift at the altar and there remember that your brother has something against you,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: leave your gift there before the altar and go. First be reconciled to your brother, and then come and offer your gift.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Come to terms quickly with your accuser while you are going with him to court, lest your accuser hand you over to the judge, and the judge to the guard, and you be put in prison.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Truly, I say to you, you will never get out until you have paid the last penny.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘You shall not commit adultery.’

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But I say to you that everyone who looks at a woman with lustful intent has already committed adultery with her in his heart.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: If your right eye causes you to sin, tear it out and throw it away. For it is better that you lose one of your members than that your whole body be thrown into hell.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And if your right hand causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away. For it is better that you lose one of your members than that your whole body go into hell.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “It was also said, ‘Whoever divorces his wife, let him give her a certificate of divorce.’

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But I say to you that everyone who divorces his wife, except on the ground of sexual immorality, makes her commit adultery, and whoever marries a divorced woman commits adultery.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Again you have heard that it was said to those of old, ‘You shall not swear falsely, but shall perform to the Lord what you have sworn.’

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But I say to you, Do not take an oath at all, either by heaven, for it is the throne of God,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: or by the earth, for it is his footstool, or by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great King.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And do not take an oath by your head, for you cannot make one hair white or black.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Let what you say be simply ‘Yes’ or ‘No’; anything more than this comes from evil.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘An eye for an eye and a tooth for a tooth.’

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But I say to you, Do not resist the one who is evil. But if anyone slaps you on the right cheek, turn to him the other also.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And if anyone would sue you and take your tunic, let him have your cloak as well.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And if anyone forces you to go one mile, go with him two miles.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Give to the one who begs from you, and do not refuse the one who would borrow from you.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘You shall love your neighbor and hate your enemy.’

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But I say to you, Love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: so that you may be sons of your Father who is in heaven. For he makes his sun rise on the evil and on the good, and sends rain on the just and on the unjust.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For if you love those who love you, what reward do you have? Do not even the tax collectors do the same?

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And if you greet only your brothers, what more are you doing than others? Do not even the Gentiles do the same?

language: ENGESV
verse_text: You therefore must be perfect, as your heavenly Father is perfect.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Beware of practicing your righteousness before other people in order to be seen by them, for then you will have no reward from your Father who is in heaven.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Thus, when you give to the needy, sound no trumpet before you, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may be praised by others. Truly, I say to you, they have received their reward.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But when you give to the needy, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: so that your giving may be in secret. And your Father who sees in secret will reward you.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “And when you pray, you must not be like the hypocrites. For they love to stand and pray in the synagogues and at the street corners, that they may be seen by others. Truly, I say to you, they have received their reward.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But when you pray, go into your room and shut the door and pray to your Father who is in secret. And your Father who sees in secret will reward you.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “And when you pray, do not heap up empty phrases as the Gentiles do, for they think that they will be heard for their many words.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Do not be like them, for your Father knows what you need before you ask him.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Pray then like this: “Our Father in heaven, hallowed be your name.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Your kingdom come, your will be done, on earth as it is in heaven.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Give us this day our daily bread,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and forgive us our debts, as we also have forgiven our debtors.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For if you forgive others their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: but if you do not forgive others their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “And when you fast, do not look gloomy like the hypocrites, for they disfigure their faces that their fasting may be seen by others. Truly, I say to you, they have received their reward.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But when you fast, anoint your head and wash your face,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: that your fasting may not be seen by others but by your Father who is in secret. And your Father who sees in secret will reward you.

language: ENGESV
verse_text:
“Do not lay up for yourselves treasures on earth, where moth and rust
     destroy and where thieves break in and steal,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust destroys and where thieves do not break in and steal.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “The eye is the lamp of the body. So, if your eye is healthy, your whole body will be full of light,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: but if your eye is bad, your whole body will be full of darkness. If then the light in you is darkness, how great is the darkness!

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “No one can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and money.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Therefore I tell you, do not be anxious about your life, what you will eat or what you will drink, nor about your body, what you will put on. Is not life more than food, and the body more than clothing?

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Look at the birds of the air: they neither sow nor reap nor gather into barns, and yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Are you not of more value than they?

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And which of you by being anxious can add a single hour to his span of life?

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And why are you anxious about clothing? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow: they neither toil nor spin,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: yet I tell you, even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But if God so clothes the grass of the field, which today is alive and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, will he not much more clothe you, O you of little faith?

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Therefore do not be anxious, saying, ‘What shall we eat?’ or ‘What shall we drink?’ or ‘What shall we wear?’

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For the Gentiles seek after all these things, and your heavenly Father knows that you need them all.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But seek first the kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these things will be added to you.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Therefore do not be anxious about tomorrow, for tomorrow will be anxious for itself. Sufficient for the day is its own trouble.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Judge not, that you be not judged.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For with the judgment you pronounce you will be judged, and with the measure you use it will be measured to you.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Why do you see the speck that is in your brother's eye, but do not notice the log that is in your own eye?

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Or how can you say to your brother, ‘Let me take the speck out of your eye,’ when there is the log in your own eye?

language: ENGESV
verse_text: You hypocrite, first take the log out of your own eye, and then you will see clearly to take the speck out of your brother's eye.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Do not give dogs what is holy, and do not throw your pearls before pigs, lest they trample them underfoot and turn to attack you.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For everyone who asks receives, and the one who seeks finds, and to the one who knocks it will be opened.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Or which one of you, if his son asks him for bread, will give him a stone?

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Or if he asks for a fish, will give him a serpent?

language: ENGESV
verse_text: If you then, who are evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father who is in heaven give good things to those who ask him!

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “So whatever you wish that others would do to you, do also to them, for this is the Law and the Prophets.

language: ENGESV
verse_text:
“Enter by the narrow gate. For the gate is wide and the way is easy
     that leads to destruction, and those who enter by it are many.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For the gate is narrow and the way is hard that leads to life, and those who find it are few.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Beware of false prophets, who come to you in sheep's clothing but inwardly are ravenous wolves.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: You will recognize them by their fruits. Are grapes gathered from thornbushes, or figs from thistles?

language: ENGESV
verse_text: So, every healthy tree bears good fruit, but the diseased tree bears bad fruit.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: A healthy tree cannot bear bad fruit, nor can a diseased tree bear good fruit.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Every tree that does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Thus you will recognize them by their fruits.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Not everyone who says to me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ will enter the kingdom of heaven, but the one who does the will of my Father who is in heaven.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: On that day many will say to me, ‘Lord, Lord, did we not prophesy in your name, and cast out demons in your name, and do many mighty works in your name?’

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And then will I declare to them, ‘I never knew you; depart from me, you workers of lawlessness.’

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Everyone then who hears these words of mine and does them will be like a wise man who built his house on the rock.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And the rain fell, and the floods came, and the winds blew and beat on that house, but it did not fall, because it had been founded on the rock.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And everyone who hears these words of mine and does not do them will be like a foolish man who built his house on the sand.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And the rain fell, and the floods came, and the winds blew and beat against that house, and it fell, and great was the fall of it.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And when Jesus finished these sayings, the crowds were astonished at his teaching,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: for he was teaching them as one who had authority, and not as their scribes.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: When he came down from the mountain, great crowds followed him.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And behold, a leper came to him and knelt before him, saying, “Lord, if you will, you can make me clean.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And Jesus stretched out his hand and touched him, saying, “I will; be clean.” And immediately his leprosy was cleansed.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And Jesus said to him, “See that you say nothing to anyone, but go, show yourself to the priest and offer the gift that Moses commanded, for a proof to them.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: When he entered Capernaum, a centurion came forward to him, appealing to him,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Lord, my servant is lying paralyzed at home, suffering terribly.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And he said to him, “I will come and heal him.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But the centurion replied, “Lord, I am not worthy to have you come under my roof, but only say the word, and my servant will be healed.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For I too am a man under authority, with soldiers under me. And I say to one, ‘Go,’ and he goes, and to another, ‘Come,’ and he comes, and to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: When Jesus heard this, he marveled and said to those who followed him, “Truly, I tell you, with no one in Israel have I found such faith.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: I tell you, many will come from east and west and recline at table with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: while the sons of the kingdom will be thrown into the outer darkness. In that place there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And to the centurion Jesus said, “Go; let it be done for you as you have believed.” And the servant was healed at that very moment.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And when Jesus entered Peter's house, he saw his mother-in-law lying sick with a fever.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: He touched her hand, and the fever left her, and she rose and began to serve him.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: That evening they brought to him many who were oppressed by demons, and he cast out the spirits with a word and healed all who were sick.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: This was to fulfill what was spoken by the prophet Isaiah: “He took our illnesses and bore our diseases.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Now when Jesus saw a crowd around him, he gave orders to go over to the other side.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And a scribe came up and said to him, “Teacher, I will follow you wherever you go.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And Jesus said to him, “Foxes have holes, and birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay his head.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Another of the disciples said to him, “Lord, let me first go and bury my father.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And Jesus said to him, “Follow me, and leave the dead to bury their own dead.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And when he got into the boat, his disciples followed him.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And behold, there arose a great storm on the sea, so that the boat was being swamped by the waves; but he was asleep.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And they went and woke him, saying, “Save us, Lord; we are perishing.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And he said to them, “Why are you afraid, O you of little faith?” Then he rose and rebuked the winds and the sea, and there was a great calm.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And the men marveled, saying, “What sort of man is this, that even winds and sea obey him?”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And when he came to the other side, to the country of the Gadarenes, two demon-possessed men met him, coming out of the tombs, so fierce that no one could pass that way.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And behold, they cried out, “What have you to do with us, O Son of God? Have you come here to torment us before the time?”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Now a herd of many pigs was feeding at some distance from them.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And the demons begged him, saying, “If you cast us out, send us away into the herd of pigs.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And he said to them, “Go.” So they came out and went into the pigs, and behold, the whole herd rushed down the steep bank into the sea and drowned in the waters.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: The herdsmen fled, and going into the city they told everything, especially what had happened to the demon-possessed men.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And behold, all the city came out to meet Jesus, and when they saw him, they begged him to leave their region.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And getting into a boat he crossed over and came to his own city.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And behold, some people brought to him a paralytic, lying on a bed. And when Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralytic, “Take heart, my son; your sins are forgiven.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And behold, some of the scribes said to themselves, “This man is blaspheming.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But Jesus, knowing their thoughts, said, “Why do you think evil in your hearts?

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For which is easier, to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Rise and walk’?

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins”—he then said to the paralytic—“Rise, pick up your bed and go home.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And he rose and went home.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: When the crowds saw it, they were afraid, and they glorified God, who had given such authority to men.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: As Jesus passed on from there, he saw a man called Matthew sitting at the tax booth, and he said to him, “Follow me.” And he rose and followed him.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And as Jesus reclined at table in the house, behold, many tax collectors and sinners came and were reclining with Jesus and his disciples.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And when the Pharisees saw this, they said to his disciples, “Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But when he heard it, he said, “Those who are well have no need of a physician, but those who are sick.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Go and learn what this means, ‘I desire mercy, and not sacrifice.’ For I came not to call the righteous, but sinners.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then the disciples of John came to him, saying, “Why do we and the Pharisees fast, but your disciples do not fast?”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And Jesus said to them, “Can the wedding guests mourn as long as the bridegroom is with them? The days will come when the bridegroom is taken away from them, and then they will fast.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: No one puts a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old garment, for the patch tears away from the garment, and a worse tear is made.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Neither is new wine put into old wineskins. If it is, the skins burst and the wine is spilled and the skins are destroyed. But new wine is put into fresh wineskins, and so both are preserved.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: While he was saying these things to them, behold, a ruler came in and knelt before him, saying, “My daughter has just died, but come and lay your hand on her, and she will live.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And Jesus rose and followed him, with his disciples.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And behold, a woman who had suffered from a discharge of blood for twelve years came up behind him and touched the fringe of his garment,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: for she said to herself, “If I only touch his garment, I will be made well.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Jesus turned, and seeing her he said, “Take heart, daughter; your faith has made you well.” And instantly the woman was made well.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And when Jesus came to the ruler's house and saw the flute players and the crowd making a commotion,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: he said, “Go away, for the girl is not dead but sleeping.” And they laughed at him.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But when the crowd had been put outside, he went in and took her by the hand, and the girl arose.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And the report of this went through all that district.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And as Jesus passed on from there, two blind men followed him, crying aloud, “Have mercy on us, Son of David.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: When he entered the house, the blind men came to him, and Jesus said to them, “Do you believe that I am able to do this?” They said to him, “Yes, Lord.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then he touched their eyes, saying, “According to your faith be it done to you.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And their eyes were opened. And Jesus sternly warned them, “See that no one knows about it.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But they went away and spread his fame through all that district.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: As they were going away, behold, a demon-oppressed man who was mute was brought to him.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And when the demon had been cast out, the mute man spoke. And the crowds marveled, saying, “Never was anything like this seen in Israel.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But the Pharisees said, “He casts out demons by the prince of demons.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And Jesus went throughout all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues and proclaiming the gospel of the kingdom and healing every disease and every affliction.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: When he saw the crowds, he had compassion for them, because they were harassed and helpless, like sheep without a shepherd.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then he said to his disciples, “The harvest is plentiful, but the laborers are few;

language: ENGESV
verse_text: therefore pray earnestly to the Lord of the harvest to send out laborers into his harvest.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And he called to him his twelve disciples and gave them authority over unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to heal every disease and every affliction.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: The names of the twelve apostles are these: first, Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother; James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother;

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Philip and Bartholomew; Thomas and Matthew the tax collector; James the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus;

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Simon the Cananaean, and Judas Iscariot, who betrayed him.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: These twelve Jesus sent out, instructing them, “Go nowhere among the Gentiles and enter no town of the Samaritans,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: but go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And proclaim as you go, saying, ‘The kingdom of heaven is at hand.’

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Heal the sick, raise the dead, cleanse lepers, cast out demons. You received without paying; give without pay.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Acquire no gold nor silver nor copper for your belts,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: no bag for your journey, nor two tunics nor sandals nor a staff, for the laborer deserves his food.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And whatever town or village you enter, find out who is worthy in it and stay there until you depart.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: As you enter the house, greet it.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And if the house is worthy, let your peace come upon it, but if it is not worthy, let your peace return to you.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And if anyone will not receive you or listen to your words, shake off the dust from your feet when you leave that house or town.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Truly, I say to you, it will be more bearable on the day of judgment for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah than for that town.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Behold, I am sending you out as sheep in the midst of wolves, so be wise as serpents and innocent as doves.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Beware of men, for they will deliver you over to courts and flog you in their synagogues,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and you will be dragged before governors and kings for my sake, to bear witness before them and the Gentiles.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: When they deliver you over, do not be anxious how you are to speak or what you are to say, for what you are to say will be given to you in that hour.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For it is not you who speak, but the Spirit of your Father speaking through you.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Brother will deliver brother over to death, and the father his child, and children will rise against parents and have them put to death,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and you will be hated by all for my name's sake. But the one who endures to the end will be saved.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: When they persecute you in one town, flee to the next, for truly, I say to you, you will not have gone through all the towns of Israel before the Son of Man comes.

language: ENGESV
verse_text:
“A disciple is not above his teacher, nor a servant
     above his master.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: It is enough for the disciple to be like his teacher, and the servant like his master. If they have called the master of the house Beelzebul, how much more will they malign those of his household.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “So have no fear of them, for nothing is covered that will not be revealed, or hidden that will not be known.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: What I tell you in the dark, say in the light, and what you hear whispered, proclaim on the housetops.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And do not fear those who kill the body but cannot kill the soul. Rather fear him who can destroy both soul and body in hell.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Are not two sparrows sold for a penny? And not one of them will fall to the ground apart from your Father.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But even the hairs of your head are all numbered.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Fear not, therefore; you are of more value than many sparrows.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: So everyone who acknowledges me before men, I also will acknowledge before my Father who is in heaven,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: but whoever denies me before men, I also will deny before my Father who is in heaven.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Do not think that I have come to bring peace to the earth. I have not come to bring peace, but a sword.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For I have come to set a man against his father, and a daughter against her mother, and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And a person's enemies will be those of his own household.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Whoever loves father or mother more than me is not worthy of me, and whoever loves son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And whoever does not take his cross and follow me is not worthy of me.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Whoever finds his life will lose it, and whoever loses his life for my sake will find it.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Whoever receives you receives me, and whoever receives me receives him who sent me.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: The one who receives a prophet because he is a prophet will receive a prophet's reward, and the one who receives a righteous person because he is a righteous person will receive a righteous person's reward.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And whoever gives one of these little ones even a cup of cold water because he is a disciple, truly, I say to you, he will by no means lose his reward.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: When Jesus had finished instructing his twelve disciples, he went on from there to teach and preach in their cities.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Now when John heard in prison about the deeds of the Christ, he sent word by his disciples

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and said to him, “Are you the one who is to come, or shall we look for another?”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And Jesus answered them, “Go and tell John what you hear and see:

language: ENGESV
verse_text: the blind receive their sight and the lame walk, lepers are cleansed and the deaf hear, and the dead are raised up, and the poor have good news preached to them.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And blessed is the one who is not offended by me.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: As they went away, Jesus began to speak to the crowds concerning John: “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?

language: ENGESV
verse_text: What then did you go out to see? A man dressed in soft clothing? Behold, those who wear soft clothing are in kings' houses.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: What then did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and more than a prophet.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: This is he of whom it is written, “‘Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you.’

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Truly, I say to you, among those born of women there has arisen no one greater than John the Baptist. Yet the one who is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: From the days of John the Baptist until now the kingdom of heaven has suffered violence, and the violent take it by force.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For all the Prophets and the Law prophesied until John,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and if you are willing to accept it, he is Elijah who is to come.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: He who has ears to hear, let him hear.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “But to what shall I compare this generation? It is like children sitting in the marketplaces and calling to their playmates,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “‘We played the flute for you, and you did not dance; we sang a dirge, and you did not mourn.’

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, ‘He has a demon.’

language: ENGESV
verse_text: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and they say, ‘Look at him! A glutton and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’ Yet wisdom is justified by her deeds.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then he began to denounce the cities where most of his mighty works had been done, because they did not repent.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the mighty works done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But I tell you, it will be more bearable on the day of judgment for Tyre and Sidon than for you.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And you, Capernaum, will you be exalted to heaven? You will be brought down to Hades. For if the mighty works done in you had been done in Sodom, it would have remained until this day.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But I tell you that it will be more tolerable on the day of judgment for the land of Sodom than for you.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: At that time Jesus declared, “I thank you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you have hidden these things from the wise and understanding and revealed them to little children;

language: ENGESV
verse_text: yes, Father, for such was your gracious will.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: All things have been handed over to me by my Father, and no one knows the Son except the Father, and no one knows the Father except the Son and anyone to whom the Son chooses to reveal him.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Come to me, all who labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Take my yoke upon you, and learn from me, for I am gentle and lowly in heart, and you will find rest for your souls.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For my yoke is easy, and my burden is light.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: At that time Jesus went through the grainfields on the Sabbath. His disciples were hungry, and they began to pluck heads of grain and to eat.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But when the Pharisees saw it, they said to him, “Look, your disciples are doing what is not lawful to do on the Sabbath.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: He said to them, “Have you not read what David did when he was hungry, and those who were with him:

language: ENGESV
verse_text: how he entered the house of God and ate the bread of the Presence, which it was not lawful for him to eat nor for those who were with him, but only for the priests?

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Or have you not read in the Law how on the Sabbath the priests in the temple profane the Sabbath and are guiltless?

language: ENGESV
verse_text: I tell you, something greater than the temple is here.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And if you had known what this means, ‘I desire mercy, and not sacrifice,’ you would not have condemned the guiltless.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For the Son of Man is lord of the Sabbath.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: He went on from there and entered their synagogue.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And a man was there with a withered hand. And they asked him, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath?”—so that they might accuse him.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: He said to them, “Which one of you who has a sheep, if it falls into a pit on the Sabbath, will not take hold of it and lift it out?

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Of how much more value is a man than a sheep! So it is lawful to do good on the Sabbath.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then he said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” And the man stretched it out, and it was restored, healthy like the other.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But the Pharisees went out and conspired against him, how to destroy him.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Jesus, aware of this, withdrew from there. And many followed him, and he healed them all

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and ordered them not to make him known.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: This was to fulfill what was spoken by the prophet Isaiah:

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Behold, my servant whom I have chosen, my beloved with whom my soul is well pleased. I will put my Spirit upon him, and he will proclaim justice to the Gentiles.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: He will not quarrel or cry aloud, nor will anyone hear his voice in the streets;

language: ENGESV
verse_text: a bruised reed he will not break, and a smoldering wick he will not quench, until he brings justice to victory;

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and in his name the Gentiles will hope.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then a demon-oppressed man who was blind and mute was brought to him, and he healed him, so that the man spoke and saw.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And all the people were amazed, and said, “Can this be the Son of David?”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But when the Pharisees heard it, they said, “It is only by Beelzebul, the prince of demons, that this man casts out demons.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Knowing their thoughts, he said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is laid waste, and no city or house divided against itself will stand.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And if Satan casts out Satan, he is divided against himself. How then will his kingdom stand?

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And if I cast out demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your sons cast them out? Therefore they will be your judges.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But if it is by the Spirit of God that I cast out demons, then the kingdom of God has come upon you.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Or how can someone enter a strong man's house and plunder his goods, unless he first binds the strong man? Then indeed he may plunder his house.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Whoever is not with me is against me, and whoever does not gather with me scatters.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Therefore I tell you, every sin and blasphemy will be forgiven people, but the blasphemy against the Spirit will not be forgiven.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And whoever speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven, either in this age or in the age to come.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Either make the tree good and its fruit good, or make the tree bad and its fruit bad, for the tree is known by its fruit.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: You brood of vipers! How can you speak good, when you are evil? For out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaks.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: The good person out of his good treasure brings forth good, and the evil person out of his evil treasure brings forth evil.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: I tell you, on the day of judgment people will give account for every careless word they speak,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: for by your words you will be justified, and by your words you will be condemned.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then some of the scribes and Pharisees answered him, saying, “Teacher, we wish to see a sign from you.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But he answered them, “An evil and adulterous generation seeks for a sign, but no sign will be given to it except the sign of the prophet Jonah.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For just as Jonah was three days and three nights in the belly of the great fish, so will the Son of Man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: The men of Nineveh will rise up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it, for they repented at the preaching of Jonah, and behold, something greater than Jonah is here.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: The queen of the South will rise up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it, for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon, and behold, something greater than Solomon is here.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “When the unclean spirit has gone out of a person, it passes through waterless places seeking rest, but finds none.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then it says, ‘I will return to my house from which I came.’ And when it comes, it finds the house empty, swept, and put in order.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then it goes and brings with it seven other spirits more evil than itself, and they enter and dwell there, and the last state of that person is worse than the first. So also will it be with this evil generation.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: While he was still speaking to the people, behold, his mother and his brothers stood outside, asking to speak to him.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But he replied to the man who told him, “Who is my mother, and who are my brothers?”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And stretching out his hand toward his disciples, he said, “Here are my mother and my brothers!

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For whoever does the will of my Father in heaven is my brother and sister and mother.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: That same day Jesus went out of the house and sat beside the sea.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And great crowds gathered about him, so that he got into a boat and sat down. And the whole crowd stood on the beach.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And he told them many things in parables, saying: “A sower went out to sow.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And as he sowed, some seeds fell along the path, and the birds came and devoured them.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Other seeds fell on rocky ground, where they did not have much soil, and immediately they sprang up, since they had no depth of soil,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: but when the sun rose they were scorched. And since they had no root, they withered away.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Other seeds fell among thorns, and the thorns grew up and choked them.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Other seeds fell on good soil and produced grain, some a hundredfold, some sixty, some thirty.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: He who has ears, let him hear.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then the disciples came and said to him, “Why do you speak to them in parables?”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And he answered them, “To you it has been given to know the secrets of the kingdom of heaven, but to them it has not been given.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For to the one who has, more will be given, and he will have an abundance, but from the one who has not, even what he has will be taken away.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: This is why I speak to them in parables, because seeing they do not see, and hearing they do not hear, nor do they understand.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Indeed, in their case the prophecy of Isaiah is fulfilled that says: “‘You will indeed hear but never understand, and you will indeed see but never perceive.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For this people's heart has grown dull, and with their ears they can barely hear, and their eyes they have closed, lest they should see with their eyes and hear with their ears and understand with their heart and turn, and I would heal them.’

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But blessed are your eyes, for they see, and your ears, for they hear.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For truly, I say to you, many prophets and righteous people longed to see what you see, and did not see it, and to hear what you hear, and did not hear it.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Hear then the parable of the sower:

language: ENGESV
verse_text: When anyone hears the word of the kingdom and does not understand it, the evil one comes and snatches away what has been sown in his heart. This is what was sown along the path.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: As for what was sown on rocky ground, this is the one who hears the word and immediately receives it with joy,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: yet he has no root in himself, but endures for a while, and when tribulation or persecution arises on account of the word, immediately he falls away.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: As for what was sown among thorns, this is the one who hears the word, but the cares of the world and the deceitfulness of riches choke the word, and it proves unfruitful.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: As for what was sown on good soil, this is the one who hears the word and understands it. He indeed bears fruit and yields, in one case a hundredfold, in another sixty, and in another thirty.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: He put another parable before them, saying, “The kingdom of heaven may be compared to a man who sowed good seed in his field,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: but while his men were sleeping, his enemy came and sowed weeds among the wheat and went away.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: So when the plants came up and bore grain, then the weeds appeared also.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And the servants of the master of the house came and said to him, ‘Master, did you not sow good seed in your field? How then does it have weeds?’

language: ENGESV
verse_text: He said to them, ‘An enemy has done this.’ So the servants said to him, ‘Then do you want us to go and gather them?’

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But he said, ‘No, lest in gathering the weeds you root up the wheat along with them.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Let both grow together until the harvest, and at harvest time I will tell the reapers, Gather the weeds first and bind them in bundles to be burned, but gather the wheat into my barn.’”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: He put another parable before them, saying, “The kingdom of heaven is like a grain of mustard seed that a man took and sowed in his field.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: It is the smallest of all seeds, but when it has grown it is larger than all the garden plants and becomes a tree, so that the birds of the air come and make nests in its branches.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: He told them another parable. “The kingdom of heaven is like leaven that a woman took and hid in three measures of flour, till it was all leavened.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: All these things Jesus said to the crowds in parables; indeed, he said nothing to them without a parable.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: This was to fulfill what was spoken by the prophet: “I will open my mouth in parables; I will utter what has been hidden since the foundation of the world.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then he left the crowds and went into the house. And his disciples came to him, saying, “Explain to us the parable of the weeds of the field.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: He answered, “The one who sows the good seed is the Son of Man.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: The field is the world, and the good seed is the sons of the kingdom. The weeds are the sons of the evil one,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and the enemy who sowed them is the devil. The harvest is the close of the age, and the reapers are angels.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Just as the weeds are gathered and burned with fire, so will it be at the close of the age.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: The Son of Man will send his angels, and they will gather out of his kingdom all causes of sin and all law-breakers,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and throw them into the fiery furnace. In that place there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then the righteous will shine like the sun in the kingdom of their Father. He who has ears, let him hear.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “The kingdom of heaven is like treasure hidden in a field, which a man found and covered up. Then in his joy he goes and sells all that he has and buys that field.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a merchant in search of fine pearls,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: who, on finding one pearl of great value, went and sold all that he had and bought it.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a net that was thrown into the sea and gathered fish of every kind.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: When it was full, men drew it ashore and sat down and sorted the good into containers but threw away the bad.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: So it will be at the close of the age. The angels will come out and separate the evil from the righteous

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and throw them into the fiery furnace. In that place there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Have you understood all these things?” They said to him, “Yes.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And he said to them, “Therefore every scribe who has been trained for the kingdom of heaven is like a master of a house, who brings out of his treasure what is new and what is old.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And when Jesus had finished these parables, he went away from there,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and coming to his hometown he taught them in their synagogue, so that they were astonished, and said, “Where did this man get this wisdom and these mighty works?

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Is not this the carpenter's son? Is not his mother called Mary? And are not his brothers James and Joseph and Simon and Judas?

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And are not all his sisters with us? Where then did this man get all these things?”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And they took offense at him. But Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor except in his hometown and in his own household.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And he did not do many mighty works there, because of their unbelief.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: At that time Herod the tetrarch heard about the fame of Jesus,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and he said to his servants, “This is John the Baptist. He has been raised from the dead; that is why these miraculous powers are at work in him.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For Herod had seized John and bound him and put him in prison for the sake of Herodias, his brother Philip's wife,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: because John had been saying to him, “It is not lawful for you to have her.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And though he wanted to put him to death, he feared the people, because they held him to be a prophet.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But when Herod's birthday came, the daughter of Herodias danced before the company and pleased Herod,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: so that he promised with an oath to give her whatever she might ask.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Prompted by her mother, she said, “Give me the head of John the Baptist here on a platter.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And the king was sorry, but because of his oaths and his guests he commanded it to be given.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: He sent and had John beheaded in the prison,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and his head was brought on a platter and given to the girl, and she brought it to her mother.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And his disciples came and took the body and buried it, and they went and told Jesus.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Now when Jesus heard this, he withdrew from there in a boat to a desolate place by himself. But when the crowds heard it, they followed him on foot from the towns.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: When he went ashore he saw a great crowd, and he had compassion on them and healed their sick.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Now when it was evening, the disciples came to him and said, “This is a desolate place, and the day is now over; send the crowds away to go into the villages and buy food for themselves.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But Jesus said, “They need not go away; you give them something to eat.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: They said to him, “We have only five loaves here and two fish.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And he said, “Bring them here to me.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then he ordered the crowds to sit down on the grass, and taking the five loaves and the two fish, he looked up to heaven and said a blessing. Then he broke the loaves and gave them to the disciples, and the disciples gave them to the crowds.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And they all ate and were satisfied. And they took up twelve baskets full of the broken pieces left over.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And those who ate were about five thousand men, besides women and children.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Immediately he made the disciples get into the boat and go before him to the other side, while he dismissed the crowds.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And after he had dismissed the crowds, he went up on the mountain by himself to pray. When evening came, he was there alone,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: but the boat by this time was a long way from the land, beaten by the waves, for the wind was against them.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And in the fourth watch of the night he came to them, walking on the sea.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But when the disciples saw him walking on the sea, they were terrified, and said, “It is a ghost!” and they cried out in fear.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But immediately Jesus spoke to them, saying, “Take heart; it is I. Do not be afraid.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And Peter answered him, “Lord, if it is you, command me to come to you on the water.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: He said, “Come.” So Peter got out of the boat and walked on the water and came to Jesus.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But when he saw the wind, he was afraid, and beginning to sink he cried out, “Lord, save me.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Jesus immediately reached out his hand and took hold of him, saying to him, “O you of little faith, why did you doubt?”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And when they got into the boat, the wind ceased.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And those in the boat worshiped him, saying, “Truly you are the Son of God.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And when they had crossed over, they came to land at Gennesaret.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And when the men of that place recognized him, they sent around to all that region and brought to him all who were sick

language: ENGESV
verse_text: and implored him that they might only touch the fringe of his garment. And as many as touched it were made well.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then Pharisees and scribes came to Jesus from Jerusalem and said,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “Why do your disciples break the tradition of the elders? For they do not wash their hands when they eat.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: He answered them, “And why do you break the commandment of God for the sake of your tradition?

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For God commanded, ‘Honor your father and your mother,’ and, ‘Whoever reviles father or mother must surely die.’

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But you say, ‘If anyone tells his father or his mother, “What you would have gained from me is given to God,”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: he need not honor his father.’ So for the sake of your tradition you have made void the word of God.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: You hypocrites! Well did Isaiah prophesy of you, when he said:

language: ENGESV
verse_text: “‘This people honors me with their lips, but their heart is far from me;

language: ENGESV
verse_text: in vain do they worship me, teaching as doctrines the commandments of men.’”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And he called the people to him and said to them, “Hear and understand:

language: ENGESV
verse_text: it is not what goes into the mouth that defiles a person, but what comes out of the mouth; this defiles a person.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then the disciples came and said to him, “Do you know that the Pharisees were offended when they heard this saying?”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: He answered, “Every plant that my heavenly Father has not planted will be rooted up.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Let them alone; they are blind guides. And if the blind lead the blind, both will fall into a pit.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But Peter said to him, “Explain the parable to us.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And he said, “Are you also still without understanding?

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Do you not see that whatever goes into the mouth passes into the stomach and is expelled?

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But what comes out of the mouth proceeds from the heart, and this defiles a person.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For out of the heart come evil thoughts, murder, adultery, sexual immorality, theft, false witness, slander.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: These are what defile a person. But to eat with unwashed hands does not defile anyone.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And Jesus went away from there and withdrew to the district of Tyre and Sidon.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And behold, a Canaanite woman from that region came out and was crying, “Have mercy on me, O Lord, Son of David; my daughter is severely oppressed by a demon.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But he did not answer her a word. And his disciples came and begged him, saying, “Send her away, for she is crying out after us.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: He answered, “I was sent only to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But she came and knelt before him, saying, “Lord, help me.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And he answered, “It is not right to take the children's bread and throw it to the dogs.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: She said, “Yes, Lord, yet even the dogs eat the crumbs that fall from their masters' table.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then Jesus answered her, “O woman, great is your faith! Be it done for you as you desire.” And her daughter was healed instantly.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Jesus went on from there and walked beside the Sea of Galilee. And he went up on the mountain and sat down there.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And great crowds came to him, bringing with them the lame, the blind, the crippled, the mute, and many others, and they put them at his feet, and he healed them,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: so that the crowd wondered, when they saw the mute speaking, the crippled healthy, the lame walking, and the blind seeing. And they glorified the God of Israel.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then Jesus called his disciples to him and said, “I have compassion on the crowd because they have been with me now three days and have nothing to eat. And I am unwilling to send them away hungry, lest they faint on the way.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And the disciples said to him, “Where are we to get enough bread in such a desolate place to feed so great a crowd?”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And Jesus said to them, “How many loaves do you have?” They said, “Seven, and a few small fish.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And directing the crowd to sit down on the ground,

language: ENGESV
verse_text: he took the seven loaves and the fish, and having given thanks he broke them and gave them to the disciples, and the disciples gave them to the crowds.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And they all ate and were satisfied. And they took up seven baskets full of the broken pieces left over.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Those who ate were four thousand men, besides women and children.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And after sending away the crowds, he got into the boat and went to the region of Magadan.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And the Pharisees and Sadducees came, and to test him they asked him to show them a sign from heaven.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: He answered them, “When it is evening, you say, ‘It will be fair weather, for the sky is red.’

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And in the morning, ‘It will be stormy today, for the sky is red and threatening.’ You know how to interpret the appearance of the sky, but you cannot interpret the signs of the times.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: An evil and adulterous generation seeks for a sign, but no sign will be given to it except the sign of Jonah.” So he left them and departed.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: When the disciples reached the other side, they had forgotten to bring any bread.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Jesus said to them, “Watch and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And they began discussing it among themselves, saying, “We brought no bread.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But Jesus, aware of this, said, “O you of little faith, why are you discussing among yourselves the fact that you have no bread?

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Do you not yet perceive? Do you not remember the five loaves for the five thousand, and how many baskets you gathered?

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Or the seven loaves for the four thousand, and how many baskets you gathered?

language: ENGESV
verse_text: How is it that you fail to understand that I did not speak about bread? Beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then they understood that he did not tell them to beware of the leaven of bread, but of the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Now when Jesus came into the district of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, “Who do people say that the Son of Man is?”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And they said, “Some say John the Baptist, others say Elijah, and others Jeremiah or one of the prophets.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Simon Peter replied, “You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And Jesus answered him, “Blessed are you, Simon Bar-Jonah! For flesh and blood has not revealed this to you, but my Father who is in heaven.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And I tell you, you are Peter, and on this rock I will build my church, and the gates of hell shall not prevail against it.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven, and whatever you bind on earth shall be bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then he strictly charged the disciples to tell no one that he was the Christ.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: From that time Jesus began to show his disciples that he must go to Jerusalem and suffer many things from the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and on the third day be raised.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him, saying, “Far be it from you, Lord! This shall never happen to you.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But he turned and said to Peter, “Get behind me, Satan! You are a hindrance to me. For you are not setting your mind on the things of God, but on the things of man.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Then Jesus told his disciples, “If anyone would come after me, let him deny himself and take up his cross and follow me.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For whoever would save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for my sake will find it.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For what will it profit a man if he gains the whole world and forfeits his soul? Or what shall a man give in return for his soul?

language: ENGESV
verse_text: For the Son of Man is going to come with his angels in the glory of his Father, and then he will repay each person according to what he has done.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: Truly, I say to you, there are some standing here who will not taste death until they see the Son of Man coming in his kingdom.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And after six days Jesus took with him Peter and James, and John his brother, and led them up a high mountain by themselves.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And he was transfigured before them, and his face shone like the sun, and his clothes became white as light.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And behold, there appeared to them Moses and Elijah, talking with him.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And Peter said to Jesus, “Lord, it is good that we are here. If you wish, I will make three tents here, one for you and one for Moses and one for Elijah.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: He was still speaking when, behold, a bright cloud overshadowed them, and a voice from the cloud said, “This is my beloved Son, with whom I am well pleased; listen to him.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: When the disciples heard this, they fell on their faces and were terrified.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But Jesus came and touched them, saying, “Rise, and have no fear.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And when they lifted up their eyes, they saw no one but Jesus only.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And as they were coming down the mountain, Jesus commanded them, “Tell no one the vision, until the Son of Man is raised from the dead.”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: And the disciples asked him, “Then why do the scribes say that first Elijah must come?”

language: ENGESV
verse_text: He answered, “Elijah does come, and he will restore all things.

language: ENGESV
verse_text: But I tell you that Elijah has already come, and they did not recognize him, but did to him whatever they pleased. So also the Son of Man will certainly suffer at their hands.”

language: ENGESV
